main event: Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs) were observed over Idlewild Airport in New York on November 2, 1953. Witnesses reported sighting six reddish-orange flying objects, each several feet in diameter, traveling at high speeds with sudden turns and climbs. The objects were observed at an estimated 30 to 40 degrees above the horizon and were traveling at a speed estimated to be between 1500 to 1800 knots.
interesting points: The witnesses observed six reddish-orange flying objects at a considerable speed with sudden turns and climbs.
The objects were observed at an estimated 30 to 40 degrees above the horizon, traveling at a speed estimated to be between 1500 to 1800 knots.
There was no sound or trail associated with the objects, and they were described as hovering before moving in different directions.
The observed objects were compared to the size of a fifty-cent piece held at arm's length and were reported to be green in color.
The report includes hand-drawn diagrams and aerial views of the airport where the sightings occurred.
witnesses: A. E. Stehling, Jr., other witnesses at the airport
